column5: Our Walleye trip didn't pan out anywhere as successful as yours. Not a single Pic was landed. You guys did fantastic, congrats. But I did get a personal best Northern that was released. That recipe sounds delicious, now all I need is a nice Walter.
wow!! Awesome walleye opener. Food looks delicious...i bet it was ...good to see you back, love your reports
Nice post Jacques, good fish results, nice cooking setup 'n everything. You are a lucky dood! Thanks for sharing.

May 20th 2016 could not come soon enough... My friend Paul and I got busy targeting walleyes and got rewarded  Caught them throwing perch pattern jerk baits, Thunder Stick in 2' to 5' foot of water and jigging 1/4oz jigs with twister tails in chartreuse & white, tipped with a worm, in 8' feet of water  Enjoy....  Couple of Brutes    Gold on ice    Stir Fry     No second Guessing.... Homemade Measuring Board    Fish On!!! Troutjunkie

The stir fry was awesome!!!  I had anticipated a break down in the walleye chunks, but did'nt happen  It was one of the best meal I ever had   The ingredients that does not show in the picture is, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Worcestershire, Soya sauce, salt & pepper, butter.... simple and delicious
Sounds fantastic! I must try
Sounds fantastic! I must try  Yes a must for sure.... one of the best meal I had   If you want, I could give you the run down of the receipe?
Yes please! I just happen to have fresh walleye right now too.  Hook me up!  Miigwech
Great walleye opener! Glad to hear from you again  By the way, the tip ups you made me still work perfectly

Yes please! I just happen to have fresh walleye right now too.  Hook me up!  Miigwech  Ok Rick here goes.... First cut your veggies in bite chunks (veggies you like & the more the better) and your walleye filets.  Fine chop garlic, ginger and scallions.  In a hot wok, add extra virgin olive oil to cover 2/3 of the bottom, a dab of butter, add your garlic and ginger.... let sizzle for few seconds.  Add the chunks of walleye, make sure they are laying flat on the long side.  Flip the chunks and let them sizzle for the same amount of time.  When you see the chunks almost cook thru, add your veggies, soya, worcestershire and balsamic vinaigre (caution on balsamic, just a few drizzle).  toss all the ingredients and cover for a minute..... uncover and toss some more....  add bean sprouts and water chestnuts to the mix.   When the beans are looking semi cooked, sprinkle the scallions over and it's time to serve and enjoy  Great walleye opener! Glad to hear from you again  By the way, the tip ups you made me still work perfectly  Thanks Chad!!!  Glad to see them tipups doing it's job
Nice! Ill giver a whirl. Sound like a great meal(and a possible new shore lunch dish)  Many thanks!
Nice! Ill giver a whirl. Sound like a great meal(and a possible new shore lunch dish)  Many thanks!  Your welcome Rick!!!  My pleasure
